title: Drawing, Design "A" for Stand of Whitewood and Stained Walnut, 1900–05
title_raw: Design "A" for Stand of Whitewood and Stained Walnut
medium: Graphite, red color pencil on thin cream paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, along bottom edge of sheet: STAND OF WHITEWOOD / stained walnut / scale 1 inch = 1 foot; in red pencil, lower left corner of sheet: A; in graphite, upper center of elevation: OLD CABINET; below center, above stretcher shelf: shelf; across lower  and right edges of elevation and at center of side view, numerical notations indicating dimensions
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Elevation left and side view right; rectangular cabinet with elaborate stylized metalwork on front panel; pair of hinged plates surround keyhole escutcheon center; raised on columnar, slightly flaring supports joined below by shelf-like stretcher; side view shows cabinet standing on 2 bracket-shaped platforms joined above by molded panel with arch-like cut-out center.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design "A" for Stand of Whitewood and Stained Walnut, 1900–05. Graphite, red color pencil on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-230
